page.title: 15Children's clubs
page.content: One of the popular clubs in the Kevington/St.Mary Cray area for girls of between 7 and 16 is the majorettes. The majorettes practice every Thursday at Kevington School for 2 hours at a cost of 30p a session. During this time they practice baton twirling and learn moves like "platters","figure of eights", "spinners" and "pompoms". The majorettes take part in carnivals, parade at village fetes and old peoples homes and take part in competitions as far away as Denmark. The boys of a similar age group usually make up marching bands that accompany the majorettes at their performances.
